description: An illustration of a painting consisting several large rectangles in various shades of red; nested inside the red rectangles are various sized gray and beige rectangles. The painting is similar to the work "Untitled Variant/Adobe (Grey, Black, Red)" (1947) by the artist Josef Albers. The illustration is not an exact match to "Untitled Variant/Adobe (Grey, Black, Red)" because there were many variations of this painting consisting of different colors.

author.name: VertexArchive
author.description: An UNOFFICIAL archive of the New York Times' Vertex puzzle. This account is not affiliated with the NY Times. I just like the triangles.
